channel.title: Posts on preston.io
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on preston.io

item.title: CI Server
item.description: How to build a ci server in go For my new blog, I wanted to have the same sort of developer experience as I do with most of my work projects. In most cases, building and deploying are either automated or a single script. I didn’t want to set up Jenkins or TeamCity or what have you. I had a simpler set of requirements in mind. My ideal workflow for a static blog would be: drafting content in markdown and pushing commits to git.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: hello world! err := boop() if err != nil { panic(err) }
